title: Rob law

properties.name: description
properties.value: Rob Law (also known as Rab or Moderator) was one of the few people who helped develop RuneScape before its public release in 2001. Starting as one of four alpha testers, he playtested updates made to the game beginning in February 2000. In October 2000 he started writing RuneScript himself and developed four quests for the game. He worked closely with Andrew Gower as an in game Moderator, listed in the credits of the 2001 RuneScape Beta for additional quest design and also part of the 2002 Jagex Team as Freelance staff for Quest design.

content:
Rob Law (also known as Rab or Moderator) was one of the few people who helped develop RuneScape before its public release in 2001. Starting as one of four alpha testers, he playtested updates made to the game beginning in February 2000. In October 2000 he started writing RuneScript himself and developed four quests for the game. He worked closely with Andrew Gower as an in game Moderator, listed in the credits of the 2001 RuneScape Beta for additional quest design and also part of the 2002 Jagex Team as Freelance staff for Quest design.

Contributions[edit | edit source]

  • Romeo & Juliet
  • Prince Ali Rescue
  • Doric's Quest
rawContent:
'''Rob Law''' (also known as ''Rab'' or ''Moderator'') was one of the few people who helped develop RuneScape before its public release in 2001. Starting as one of four alpha testers, he playtested updates made to the game beginning in February 2000. In October 2000 he started writing RuneScript himself and developed four quests for the game. He worked closely with Andrew Gower as an in game Moderator, listed in the credits of the 2001 RuneScape Beta for additional quest design and also part of the 2002 Jagex Team as Freelance staff for Quest design.

==Contributions==
* [[Romeo & Juliet]]
* [[Prince Ali Rescue]]
* [[Doric's Quest]]
